definition: (of an illness, debt etc) to plague sb/to preoccupy sb/difficult to get rid of
to wind around/to wrap round/to coil/tangle/to involve/to bother/to annoy
body/life/oneself/personally/one's morality and conduct/the main part of a structure or body/pregnant/classifier for sets of clothes: suit, twinset/Kangxi radical 158

sentences.english: Too ill to get out of bed, she had strong feelings of uselessness.
sentences.chinese: 由於疾病纏身，臥牀不起，她深深感到力不從心。

sentences.english: Neymar has also been dogged by allegations related to tax evasion.
sentences.chinese: 內馬爾還被有關逃稅的指控纏身。

sentences.english: The violators whom the Federal Election Commission detects may land in trouble.
sentences.chinese: 這些違規的人被聯邦選舉委發現可就麻煩纏身了。
喜歡癱瘓和病魔纏身的題材？

sentences.english: The old lady is never free from paining.
sentences.chinese: 這位老太太連續病痛纏身。

sentences.english: After his conversation with the Governor, a lot happened to distract Steve from his new cause.
sentences.chinese: 在他與州長的對話以後，史蒂夫公務纏身。

sentences.english: She looked as she had a dozen years ago, before the disease had begun.
sentences.chinese: 她看來就如同十幾年前病魔尚未纏身時那樣。

sentences.english: Hu declined to name the debt-ridden university.
sentences.chinese: 胡拒絕透露這所債務纏身學校的名稱。

sentences.english: His affairs in France keep him long overdue.
sentences.chinese: 他在法國公務纏身，還得待很久。

sentences.english: He was never terribly sick, but he always thought he was.
sentences.chinese: 他從來沒什麼大病，但他總認爲自己重病纏身。

sentences.english: He seems to be dying from cancer.
sentences.chinese: 他因癌症纏身而日見衰弱無力。

sentences.english: After returning to the Kahn still has trouble-ridden, scandal into several piles.
sentences.chinese: 回國後的卡恩仍一直麻煩纏身，陷入數樁醜聞事件。

sentences.english: I'm domesticated now. Two children. And Don is putting on weight.
sentences.chinese: 我現在是家務纏身啦，有了兩個孩子啦，塘思現在可。

sentences.english: Because it's always out of cash and always in debt.
sentences.chinese: 因爲它總是缺錢花，又總是債務纏身。

sentences.english: Can you imagine a woman with serious illness manage a website by herself?
sentences.chinese: 你能想象一個病魔纏身的婦女獨自經營一個網站嗎？

sentences.english: She has been afflicted with a serious illness.

definition: lit. to have one's hands bound and be unable to do anything about it (idiom); fig. helpless in the face of a crisis
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to lose one's job/unemployment/not to fulfill one's obligations/to neglect one's job/dereliction of duty
to stir up trouble/to invite disaster
to get away/to escape (from obligations)/to free oneself/to disengage
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
